title: Simple Interest Formula
text: The formula for simple interest is $$I=Prt$$, with I being interest, P being the initial amount of money invested (also called principal), r being the rate, and t being the time.

title: Variable in question
text: What do we want to find? In other words, what variable are we looking for?

title: Finding the value for P
text: How much money did Loren loan his brother? Write without the dollar sign

title: Finding the value for I
text: How much interest did his brother pay? Write without the dollar sign.

title: Finding the value for t
text: How many years are we considering?

title: Solving for r
text: The next step is to manipulate the formula so that we can solve for r.

title: r equation
text: The formula for the rate in a simple interest equation is $$r=\frac{I}{P t}$$

title: r value as a percentage
text: Remember that rates are expressed as percents. Write the expression that will convert our answer into a percentage.
